conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows from point A downward.
Liquid encounters a yellow baffle that directs the flow to the right.
Liquid continues to flow downward after passing the yellow baffle.
Liquid encounters a red baffle which does not block the downward flow.
Liquid flows past a gray baffle and continues downward.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container D from point A.
Liquid flows from point B downward.
Liquid encounters a yellow baffle that directs the flow to the left.
Liquid continues to flow downward after passing the yellow baffle.
Liquid encounters a red baffle which does not block the downward flow.
Liquid flows past a gray baffle and continues downward.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container D from point B.
Liquid flows from point C downward.
Liquid encounters a yellow baffle that directs the flow to the left.
Liquid continues to flow downward after passing the yellow baffle.
Liquid encounters a red baffle which does not block the downward flow.
Liquid flows past a gray baffle and continues downward.
Liquid reaches the bottom and flows into container D from point C.
All three points (A, B, and C) direct the liquid flow to container D.
Baffles guide the liquid flow in a manner that prevents it from reaching container E.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles from points A, B, and C.
